org.propelgraph.util

Class LoadJSON2

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.propelgraph.util.LoadJSON2

  • public class LoadJSON2
extends Object
    This class provides functionality for loading json graph files of the form... 
    [

    {
    "node_id": "139146904",
    "node_type": "user",
    "user_name": "Jane Doe",
    "user_screen_name": "ABCDEconsulting",
    "user_location": "Atlanta",
    "user_followers_count": 1464,
    "user_profile_image_url": "http://pbs.mmm.com/what.png"
    },
    {
    "edge_id": "139146904_572070087009669891",
    "edge_type": "create",
    "source_node": "139146994",
    "end_node": "572070087009969121",
    "end_node_type": "tweet",
    "time": "2015-03-01T16:25:11",
    "timestamp_ms": 1425227133348
    },
    ...
]
    Author:
    ccjason (03/16/2015)

    • Method Detail

      • configureNeedPrefixes

        public void configureNeedPrefixes(boolean newval)
        configure the loader to prefix property names and label names with 'p' and 'l' respectively before loading. This is to work around the limitation of graphs like Titan's that don't allow a graph's set of property names and label names to overlap. By default this flag is configured as false, but the caller should set this to true before invoing the loader if they are using a graph implementation like Titan's that has this restriction and the read graph might contain combinations of labels and property names that prevent the graph from being loaded by the graph implementation being used.
        Parameters:
        newval -

      • configure

        public void configure(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser.Feature feature,
             boolean val)
        adjust the JSON parser used by this class. We have found that the following is often helpful: 
         lj.configure(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser.Feature.ALLOW_BACKSLASH_ESCAPING_ANY_CHARACTER, true);
 lj.configure(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser.Feature.ALLOW_UNQUOTED_CONTROL_CHARS, true);
        Parameters:
        feature -
        val -

      • populateFromJSONStream

        public void populateFromJSONStream(Graph g,
                          InputStream is,
                          long maxElements)
                            throws IOException
        add vertices and edges to the specified graph based on the content found in the provided InputStream This method skips adding vertices and edges that it's already seen. In the case of edges, it checks for only the edges added in the previous two invocation of this method of this object.
        Parameters:
        g - the graph to update
        is - is the input stream
        max - maximum number of elements to process
        Throws:
        IOException

        populate graph from the JSON data at the specified url.
        Parameters:

        strURL -

        max - maximum number of triples to process
        Throws:
